Description: Attic black-glazed pottery handleless calyx-cup (mended from three (?) fragments; rim lost); glazed black throughout; concave upper body decorated with garland of ivy leaves in added clay; convex lower body decorated with grooved tongues which meet near the base; scraped groove between upper and lower sections of body; in interior: boss in the form of a plastic mask (satyr or Black African?) on a rectangle; underside: scraped groove around central boss with nipple.
Curator's comments: Published by Gunter Kopcke, 'Golddekorierte attische Schwarzfirniskeramik des vierten Jahrhunderts V. Chr.' AM 79 (1964) pl. 44,4, noting on p.84 that it combines Classical and Hellenistic elements.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1316)
Exhibition history: 2023 4 May - 13 Aug, London, BM, G35, Luxury and Power: Persia to Greece
